Package org.sat4j.maxsat

Class WeightedMaxSatDecorator

java.lang.Object
org.sat4j.tools.SolverDecorator<org.sat4j.pb.IPBSolver>
org.sat4j.pb.PBSolverDecorator
org.sat4j.maxsat.WeightedMaxSatDecorator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, WeightedPartialMaxsat, org.sat4j.pb.IPBSolver, org.sat4j.specs.IProblem, org.sat4j.specs.ISolver, org.sat4j.specs.RandomAccessModel
public class WeightedMaxSatDecorator extends org.sat4j.pb.PBSolverDecorator implements WeightedPartialMaxsat
A decorator for solving weighted MAX SAT problems. The first value of the list of literals in the addClause() method contains the weight of the clause.
Author:
daniel
See Also:
Serialized Form

    • addClause

      public org.sat4j.specs.IConstr addClause​(org.sat4j.specs.IVecInt literals) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Add a soft clause to the solver. That method allows to read a clause in a CNF and to consider it as soft, in order to solve MAXSAT problems. Note that the behavior of that method changed in release 2.3.1. Prior to that, the method was expecting a weight as first element of the list of literals.
      Specified by:
      addClause in interface org.sat4j.specs.ISolver
      Overrides:
      addClause in class org.sat4j.tools.SolverDecorator<org.sat4j.pb.IPBSolver>
      Parameters:
      literals - a clause, whose weight will be one
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      See Also:
      #setTopWeight(int)

    • addHardClause

      public org.sat4j.specs.IConstr addHardClause​(org.sat4j.specs.IVecInt literals) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Description copied from interface: WeightedPartialMaxsat
      Add a hard clause in the solver, i.e. a clause that must be satisfied.
      Specified by:
      addHardClause in interface WeightedPartialMaxsat
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the constraint is it is not trivially satisfied.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

      Description copied from interface: WeightedPartialMaxsat
      Add a soft clause in the solver, i.e. a clause with a weight of 1.

    • addSoftClause

      public org.sat4j.specs.IConstr addSoftClause​(int weight, org.sat4j.specs.IVecInt literals) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Description copied from interface: WeightedPartialMaxsat
      Add a soft clause to the solver. if the weight of the clause is greater of equal to the top weight, the clause will be considered as a hard clause.
      Specified by:
      addSoftClause in interface WeightedPartialMaxsat
      Parameters:
      weight - the weight of the clause
      literals - the clause
      Returns:
      the constraint is it is not trivially satisfied.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

    • addSoftAtLeast

      public org.sat4j.specs.IConstr addSoftAtLeast​(org.sat4j.specs.IVecInt literals, int degree) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Allow adding a new soft cardinality constraint in the solver.
      Parameters:
      literals - the literals of the cardinality constraint.
      degree - the degree of the cardinality constraint.
      Returns:
      a pseudo boolean constraint encoding that soft constraint.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if a trivial contradiction is found.
      Since:
      2.3

    • forceObjectiveValueTo

      public void forceObjectiveValueTo​(Number forcedValue) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Force the solver to find a solution with a specific value (nice to find all optimal solutions for instance).
      Parameters:
      forcedValue - the expected value of the solution
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if that value is trivially not possible.

    • isNoNewVarForUnitSoftClauses

      public boolean isNoNewVarForUnitSoftClauses()
      Returns true if no new variable should be created when adding a soft unit clause, false otherwise. By default, this is set to true.
      Returns:

    • setNoNewVarForUnitSoftClauses

      public void setNoNewVarForUnitSoftClauses​(boolean noNewVarForUnitSoftClauses)
      Sets whether new variables should be created when adding new clauses. By default, this is set to true. This can be useful when computing all muses.
      Parameters:
      noNewVarForUnitSoftClauses -
